title: Enhancing System Design Practical Skills: Science Project-Based Learning Motivation Using the ARCS Model

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science concepts and project collaboration experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can create a project plan applying the four elements of the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction).
Through peer assessment and self-reflection, learners can apply motivation maintenance strategies at over 80% effectiveness during the science project process.
In the final presentation, learners can explain their science project results at an expert level and achieve a satisfaction score of 4/5 or higher on the evaluation rubric.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
